My favorite part is "We don't think dreams, we are in our dreams." It is true, at once I feel scary that we can't see the boundary between realities and dreams. The last scene divides our opinion. Finally, the director did it deliberately. This has fresh images and sounds. So I wanted to see in a theater. I regretted. It keeps me in suspense. I saw excellent movie. I felt that 150 minutes is too short.

Review of Inception : It is a movie that is complete in story, screenplay, cinematography, special effects, thrill and suspense. There's a bit of drama and comedy as well. The fascinating part is that you'll have to connect the dots in the film to really get what's going on. You will be engaged into it. I was drawn by the trailer then and told myself that it's worth the penny. And it did, exceedingly. I watched it alone that's why I'm so focused on it, connecting one dream to another. Christopher Nolan knows how to edit film in a way that it forms a bigger puzzle until the whole film is seen as a very big picture with depth. :) Very nice Chris Nolan!!!! I haven't seen Memento, but I will, definitely.

Review of Inception : The movie impressed me a lot. Well-thought story. Great acting. One of the better films I've seen in my life. I was a little disappointed with the ending, but I can forgive it. Applause for very good special effects. What can I say more? I recommend with all my heart. May more such films.

Review of Inception : The honey badger, or bald badger, or ratel is a species of mustelid family that lives in Africa and Asia. It stands out in the monotypic genus of honey badgers, the only one in the subfamily Mellivorinae. Known for ferocity and fearlessness at a very small size.Honey badgers are considered very fearless and even aggressive animals that have almost no natural enemies. Their very thick skin (with the exception of a thin layer on the abdomen) in some cases cannot be pierced even by the teeth of predatory large cat and poisonous snakes. Strong forepaws with long claws and teeth of honey badgers are effective defensive weapons. In addition, they are able, like skunks, to emit a stench if they are attacked. They themselves, if they feel threatened, attack animals whose size is much larger than their own, including cows and buffaloes. In its appearance, body structure, fearlessness, characteristic aggressive behavior and omnivorous nature, the honey badger is strikingly reminiscent of another representative of the mustelids, the wolverine.

Review of Inception : In Inception, Christopher Nolan (The Dark Knight, Memento), who directs and writes the film, asks the question, "Are we living in a dream world or is it real? And which is more desirable?" The viewer can answer for himself as Inception plunges him into both worlds. The arena of Inception, a system containing the wild creations of its dreamers, grows more vivid, thrilling and tangible as the movie unfolds.Leonardo DiCaprio plays Cobb, an expert extracter, someone who is able to enter the dream state of another in order to steal confidential information from their subconscious. He works mainly corporate espionage, until one of his targets, Saito (Ken Watanbe) hires him to do an inception. Instead of stealing another's ideas, he is to implant one.Cobb knows the power of ideas. In one of the opening scenes, he states that ideas are the most powerful invaders of humankind, impossible to forget and capable of growing. DiCaprio is utterly convincing as the master dreamer and leader, the one who has the power to guide the others through the maze of their dream states and get out safely. This is not an easy sell because Nolan is asking us to suspend our belief about how we comprehend reality.The dangers of inception are clear. There isn't just one level. To implant the idea, his team must go 3 levels down, to a dream within a dream within a dream, comprehending and dodging the obstacles of their target, Fischer, played by Cillian Murphy.Nolan visualizes this world powerfully. It becomes increasingly harder to distinguish the dream world from the waking world. People are in danger. Revolutionaries, security forces and armies hunt them down. Ellen Page as the architect, Ariadne, conjures up an entire cathedral-like structure on top of existing buildings through which she and Cobb roam freely, breaking the laws of physics. It's like an M.C. Escher drawing.Our willing suspension of belief is referred back to during the climactic scenes, where the team tries to guide Fisher through the deepest level of dream state so he can discover the implanted idea himself. Nolan cuts between Joseph Gordon-Levitt as Arthur, Cobb's right hand man and a sober, level headed influence, as he battles Fischer's security forces in zero gravity while the rest of the team squares off on snow-capped mountains dodging an avalanche while battling gun-toting adversaries. In "real time" the dreamers are packed in a van plunging off a bridge into slow motion.Cobb is tormented by a secret sorrow. He cannot prevent his wife from entering his dream states and destroying his plans. Ariadne acts as the outsider, the one who questions Cobb's obsession and tries to protect him and the group against it.The cast is uniformly excellent, with Tom Hardy playing Eames, the wise-cracking master of disguise and Dileep Rao as Yusuf, the chemist charged with jolting the team from their self-induced comas and driving the van plunging off the bridge. But Christopher Nolan is the master, creating enrapturing scenes that make you pause as you try to answer the question I posed at the start of this review.

Review of Inception : In this sequel to the Evil Dead films, a discount-store employee ("Name's Ash. Housewares.") is time-warped to a medieval castle beset by monstrous forces. Initially mistaken for an enemy, he is soon revealed as the prophecised savior who can quest for the Necronomicon, a book which can dispel the evil. Unfortunately, he screws up the magic words while collecting the tome, and releases an army of skeletons, led by his own Deadite counterpart. What follows is a thrilling, yet tongue-in-cheek battle between Ash's 20th Century tactics and the minions of darkness. Written by David Thiel.In this sequel to the Evil Dead films, a discount-store employee ("Name's Ash. Housewares.") is time-warped to a medieval castle beset by monstrous forces. Initially mistaken for an enemy, he is soon revealed as the prophecised savior who can quest for the Necronomicon, a book which can dispel the evil. Unfortunately, he screws up the magic words while collecting the tome, and releases an army of skeletons, led by his own Deadite counterpart. What follows is a thrilling, yet tongue-in-cheek battle between Ash's 20th Century tactics and the minions of darkness. Written by David Thiel.

Review of Inception : Inception is truly one of a kind. A concept which has long gestated in Christopher Nolan's mind, his eye for drama mixed with his large scale sensibilities ring true in Blockbuster season making Inception a true original in the sea of reboots, remakes and sequels.To try and explain Inceptions many plot twists and incredibly intelligent arcs, would be a foolish task. As Nolan himself has been reluctant to. The best way to approach the film would be with an open mind, if you are prepared to be taken on a ride of a lifetime, then trust that you 100% will. If Avatar was a seminal film in technology (although coming out as a rather poor film, in my opinion), then Inception is seminal in it's storytelling. With a 148 minute running time, you would expect a lot to take place, but what you wouldn't expect is the pace of it all. I did not think at one time in the film about how long was left. I was simply blown away by the depth in every single part of the film. If my enthusiasm for the storytelling aspect of the film has left you worried about the spectacle, then don't worry. They are, as hinted in the trailer, incredible, looking real and unbelievable simultaneously. The most pleasing thing about the action set pieces, is that they are genuinely used to illustrate the story, rather than to blow stuff up a la Michael Bay.With this complex movie in it's high concept, a stellar cast is needed. And Nolan as always, delivers with just that. This is vintage DiCaprio, perhaps only equaled in The Aviator, which is even more impressive as his role as Cobb in Inception is not a showy one, needing DiCaprio to be the constant at the center of the film. And he pulls off Cobb's emotional contradictions sublimely. The rest of the cast members all shine in parts of the films, Cillian Murphy shows off his usually non-existent tender side, Gordon-Levitt bottles his usual charm for his confidently reserved turn as the reliable Arthur, Watanabe is devilish as the seemingly ambiguous Saito, Page shows why she's the next big female star and Tom Hardy revels in being the comic relief of the film compared to his recent turns as decidedly psychopathic characters.Overall, Nolan has indeed surpassed himself. He has created a world as expansive as his Gotham, a plot dwarfing the intricacies of Memento and one which blows The Prestige's cinematic reveal out of the water. This is truly unmissable cinema. Revel in it, we've still got to wait a whole two years before Batman 3.

Review of Inception : I love this movie.it's so fantastic.Love the architecture and the soundtrack wow it's amazing. Hans Zimmer is one of my favorite composers!Christopher Nolan is a really amazing writer,producer and director. Mr.Nolan pitched the movie to Warner Bros. And they approved but the script wasn't written yet so he was thinking it would take a couple of months but the project wasn't in production until eight years later.It's so good so I strongly recommend it.You will love it as much as I do. I really love this kind of movie when you have to think a little extra to understand the movies content and what the movie is about. And when you do you realize how much they have to think about all the details and that every thing has to be connected. I think it's really cool and so fantastic how they come up with the ideas.

Review of Inception : This film is a mystery and adventure movie. Actually, I'm not good at an adventure movie but I'm interested in this film from its trailer. I really enjoy watching this film. I'm really surprised at imaging technique in this film. The world of this film is not real world but it looks like real world. I want to go the world once. I respect Ken Watanabe very much because he participates actively all over the world. He stars in this film as Saito. I think Saito is one of the key person in this story. I feel this story is a little bit complicated for me. Sometimes I was confused which world is the dream or which world is the real. This confuse leads me exciting. I can't stop having the racing pulse while I'm watching this film. The end of this film is also mysterious. I'm really excited watching this film from the top to the end. I recommend you to watch this film.

Review of Inception : I've been on a the past few days and the latest movie I saw today was inception.I was about quarter way into the film, when a friend of mine contacted me, and I started to tell him that I was watching this film. He said don't You remember–Nissan – together?I had no recollection of seeing this film beforeI tell you this because that's what apparently a good impression this film left on me - the first time.Before I go on any further another thing I need to tell you I'm not trying to be snide or anything else I'm very smart and I work in this business people don't like to go to screenings with me previews with me because I'll sit there and talk out loud - I'll say the dialog before the characters say it. I'll tell them what's going to happen. Somebody invariably will say; 'that's because you read the script.'The truth is, I rarely read the script.I can do this because so many films- especially those made in the past couple of decades or so or so much like 'paint – five – numbers,' Except it's film.I'm not here to ruin anybody's enjoyment of this picture so I will not give much away when I given a review is a review not a synopsis which so many people idiotically think is review.Let's just say inception is the puzzle within a puzzleWhen done properly you don't even know it's going on this one I got from the get-go I don't know if it's because I think the director tries to think he's too "smart" for the audience or what I just knew immediately there's a game afoot -on the audience.The next problem I had is Mr. DiCaprio. I liked him when he was young Gilbert grape but I don't know what it is I think with Time, he has really softened professionally (and physically too).The few movies that I've seen him in late seem to be more of a excuse for him to party hearty party with his buddies while making what he thinks is a"good, possible Academy Award® for him" film.I'll leave this review with The following; inception– A film about getting into one's dreams.Yawn.

Review of Inception : Good movie but I couldn't get one fundamental problem off my mind. In the movie their way out of the 3 level dream is a kick, the feeling of falling that wakes you up sometimes. The chemist says he created a sedative that will leave the inner ear functioning properly. The inner ear gives all feeling of motion to you and your brain. Meaning when the dreamer gets pushed over or falls he will wake up no matter what. Well, they execute the "big dream" or "job" on an airplane. The inner ear is constantly working in an airplane because the airplane is constantly in motion. Accelerating, decelerating, climbing, descending, turning, encountering small bumps and turbulence (i.e. fundamental problem).

Review of Inception : I saw "Inception" at the movies in 2010. I am amazed at how they were able to write the screenplay. It is the most creative movie I have ever seen. Fantastic cast- DiCaprio at his finest and one of the best movie scores Hans Zimmer has ever done. It makes the audience think and reason as any great movie should. One of my favorites after all these years- still.

Review of Inception : One of the Best Ever made. It's a classic . I mean it's Nolan. I wanted to give it a ten but The Prestige deserves it more than this. So this is great and one of the best but still not the best.A movie that will take you into another world , a ride of dreams with intense and turns at every point.Script is fairly good enough and characters are also nicely written. But just one thing its over-hyped. All the illusions and dream sequences are great , confusing and lovable but not my cup of tea. I believe Great things also come in simplicity which this one does not care to show even once. I am not citing a negative review but it has garnered much praise even though it is really not that much great. I can understand it plays with your mind but everyone has different views and my view is that its good , watchable but not very very good which everyone told me so. Some say it requires five times to understand it and with careful one watch its easy to know what Nolan does. It's not about how twisty the ending is but how it is presented and it is presented well. I have never seen this kind of film apart from the others and sixth sense but still its good enough to make you surprised but not something i will root for......
